title: 112_hr6104
content: The "Working Families Tax Protection Act of 2012" is the short title of this Act. It extends the 2001 tax relief for the middle class. The Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 provisions are extended until December 31, 2013. This includes individual income tax rate reductions, tax benefits for children, marriage penalty relief, and affordable education provisions. High-income individuals are not affected by certain provisions. The tax rate brackets are adjusted under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, with changes to the 25%, 28%, and 35% brackets for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. The tax rate brackets are adjusted under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, with changes to the 25%, 28%, and 35% brackets for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. The 39.6 percent rate of tax applies only to taxable income exceeding specified amounts, with different thresholds for different subsections. Personal exemptions and itemized deductions phase out. The tax code is amended to phase out personal exemptions and itemized deductions, with changes to the applicable thresholds and elimination of certain subsections. The tax code is amended to phase out personal exemptions and itemized deductions, with changes to the applicable thresholds and elimination of certain subsections, including redesignating subparagraphs and clauses. The tax code is amended to phase out personal exemptions and itemized deductions, with changes to the applicable thresholds and elimination of certain subsections, including redesignating subparagraphs and clauses. Inflation adjustment for taxable years beginning after 1989 is also addressed. Application of sunsets to individual income tax rates and phaseout of personal exemptions and itemized deductions is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2012. Extension of 2003 tax relief for the middle class starting after December 31, 2012. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is amended to extend tax relief provisions until December 31, 2013. Certain provisions regarding high-income individuals are also modified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust tax rates on dividends and capital gains for high-income individuals. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 extends tax relief provisions until December 31, 2013. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust tax rates on dividends and capital gains for high-income individuals. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 extends tax relief provisions until December 31, 2013. Additionally, a new subsection is added regarding the application of the maximum rate of tax on net capital gain of noncorporate taxpayers, with adjustments to the percentages and conforming amendments. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust tax rates on dividends and capital gains for high-income individuals. Sections of the Code are amended to change tax rates and sunset provisions are applied. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2012, with specific withholding amendments effective for payments made on or after January 1, 2013. SEC. 4 extends the 2009 tax relief by amending various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include 2013 in addition to 2012 for the American Opportunity Tax Credit, Child Tax Credit, and Earned Income Tax Credit. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.
